DataElement.preferredName: Person Histologic Or Cytology Confirmation Malignant Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to questions which are necessary to allow a patient to participate in a clinical study addressing the histological or cytological verification of malignant neoplastic disease as outlined in the clinical trial protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Histologic Or Cytology Confirmation Malignant Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The light microscopic study of normal and abnormal cells in fine needle aspirates (FNAs), body cavity fluids, and smears._Having been established or verified._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Histologic Or Cytology Confirmation Malignant Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The light microscopic study of normal and abnormal cells in fine needle aspirates (FNAs), body cavity fluids, and smears.:Having been established or verified.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The light microscopic study of normal and abnormal cells in fine needle aspirates (FNAs), body cavity fluids, and smears.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/29/16 tt, curated for 9950; approved and released.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have histologica
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed head and neck squamous cell cancer (HNSCC) including paranasal sinus cancers but excluding nasopharyngeal carcinomas?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of extensive-stage small cell lung cancer with no prior systemic treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed non-small cell lung cancer (cohort 1) or colorectal cancer (cohort 2)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologic or cytologic diagnosis of Non-melanoma skin cancer (NMSC) or lymphomas other than B-cell lymphomas as defined in section 3.1.1 of the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically and/or cytologically confirmed solid tumors or B cell lymphoma that are metastatic or unresectable and for which standard treatment options do not exist?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically-confirmed diagnosis of locally advanced/unresectable (inoperable or not amenable to surgical treatment) and/or metastatic transitional cell urothelial cancer of the renal pelvis, ureter, urinary bladder, or urethra?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed epithelial endometrial carcinoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed metastatic or recurrent non-small cell lung cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed prostate cancer (code 10036910)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed adenocarcinoma of the colon or rectum that is metastatic and/or unresectable?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Therdadex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically documented locally advanced/inoperable or metastatic UBC, including renal pelvis, ureters, urinary bladder, and urethra?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed locally recurrent HNSCC without or with minimal metastases (sum diameters <2cm in pulmonary or mediastinal nodes, or other sites beyond regional cervical lymph nodes), for whom re-irradiation for local control is considered standard of care?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed non-small cell lung cancer, SCCHN/Bladder Cancer/cSCC (cohort 1) or colorectal cancer (cohort 2)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of extensive-stage small cell lung cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed pancreatic adenocarcinoma that is metastatic or unresectable or recurrent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed relapsed CD19+ NHL (included in this category are follicular grade I, II, III, marginal zone, mantle cell, gray zone, primary mediastinal, Burkitts, diffuse large B cell, small lymphocytic lymphoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed NUT Carcinoma (NC) based on at least one of the following criteria: a. Ectopic expression of NUT protein (greater than 50% tumor nuclei) as determined by IHC testing performed in a CLIA certified laboratory; OR b. Detection of the NUT gene translocation as determined by FISH performed at the Brigham and Women's Hospital (BWH) Center for Advanced Molecular Diagnostics (CAMD)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patients must have histologically or cytologically confirmed CD2+, CD3+, or CD4+ acute, lymphoma or poor-risk chronic subtypes of ATLL including previously untreated or previously treated individuals who have received no more than 1 previous cycle of EPOCH, CHOP, or CHOPE?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed esophageal cancer (either squamous cell or adenocarcinoma), including Siewert gastroesophageal junction adenocarcinomas Types 1 and 2, that is inoperable and not eligible for definitive chemoradiation after multidisciplinary review or have pathologically confirmed or imaging consistent with metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed malignancy at the time of initial diagnosis, relapse, or recurrence?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically proven adenocarcinoma of the rectum with no evidence of distant metastasis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient does not have histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of cancer has approval been requested and received from the Study Coordinator at the NCI Coordinating Site?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have documented EWSR1/ATF1 or EWSR1/CREB1 translocation or histologically confirmed clear cell sarcoma, documented grade 2 or 3 conventional chondrosarcoma, or documented dedifferentiated chondrosarcoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: If enrolled in the Dose Expansion Cohort, does patient have histologically confirmed advanced pancreatic adenocarcinoma or ovarian cancer (high grade serous ovarian, primary peritoneal or fallopian tube cancer) that is not curable with standard approaches?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed recurrent, unresectable head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, including oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, hypopharynx, or cervical lymphadenopathy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed prostate cancer (code 10036910) with progressive disease at the time of study entry by either sequence of at least 2 rising PSA values at a minimum of 1-week intervals or radiographic progression per RECIST1.1 for soft tissue and/or per PCWG32 for bone, with or without PSA progression?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: For the Dose-expansion phase: Does patient have histologically confirmed advanced/metastatic gastroesophageal cancer (cohort A) or colorectal cancer (cohort B)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically documented locally advanced (T4b, any N; or any T, N 2-3) or metastatic (M1, Stage IV; or metastatic recurrence after locoregional treatment) urothelial carcinoma (including renal pelvis, ureters, urinary bladder, urethra)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: For dose escalation: Does patient have A) histologically or cytologically confirmed Iow lying (up to 6 cm from anal verge) rectal adenocarcinoma eligible for radiation therapy to rectal tumor, B) If the treatment is palliative in the metastatic setting, no additional requirements for tumor size or nodal involvement is needed. C) If the treatment is in the neoadjuvant setting, the tumor must ALSO be high-risk locally advanced rectal cancer defined as T3-4, N+, and/or at risk for a positive radial margin (as determined by the surgeon)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed locally recurrent HNSCC, including nasopharyngeal or sinonasal cancer for whom re-irradiation for local control is considered standard of care?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does participant have a diagnosis of NC based on standard criteria for the disease, with diagnostic testing performed in a CLIA certified laboratory: a. Ectopic expression of NUT protein per WHO criteria (World Health Organization [WHO], 2021) as determined by IHC testing OR b. Detection of the NUT gene translocation as determined by FISH testing OR c. Detection of the NUT gene translocation as determined by sequencing, e.g. DNA NGS or RNA sequencing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have pathologically confirmed HNSCC (including tumors of the oropharynx, hypopharynx, larynx, oral cavity, nasal cavity, maxillary and other paranasal sinuses, and unknown primary of the head and neck)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologic verification of LCH (from either original diagnosis and/or relapse/progression) at the time of study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumor with positive Dotatate scan (Gallium 68 or Copper 64) (as determined by the site PI) within 6 months before enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled in the randomized arms, does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed Alveolar Soft Part Sarcoma that is not curable by surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 36
ReferenceDocuments.description: Dose Expansion Cohort Only:  Does patient have a diagnosis of NC based on standard criteria for the disease, with diagnostic testing performed in a CLIA certified laboratory: Ectopic expression of NUT protein (>50% tumor nuclei) as determined by IHC testing, OR  Detection of the NUT gene translocation as determined by FISH testing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 35
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed adenocarcinoma or large cell carcinoma of the lung with confirmation by immunohistochemistry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 37
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed pancreatic cancer (excluding islets) (NOS) (MEDDRA code: 10033612)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 38
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically-confirmed urothelial carcinoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 40
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed salivary gland cancer that is recurrent/metastatic or unresectable/locally advanced, with AR expression detected by IHC on a CLIA-approved assay?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 41
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed recurrent, unresectable head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, including oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, hypopharynx, cutaneous, salivary gland, paranasal sinus or cervical lymphadenopathy (head and neck cancer of unknown primary)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 42
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of pathologically confirmed locally advanced/unresectable Merkel cell carcinoma or metastatic Merkel cell carcinoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have locoregionally advanced head and neck squamous cell carcinoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 43
ReferenceDocuments.description: Dose Expansion Cohort Only:  Does patient have a diagnosis of NC based on standard criteria for the disease, with diagnostic testing performed in a CLIA certified laborator: Ectopic expression of NUT protein per WHO criteria (World Health Organization [WHO], 2021) as determined by IHC testing, OR Detection of the NUT gene translocation as determined by FISH testing, OR Detection of the NUT gene translocation as determined by either DNA NGS or RNA sequencing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 44
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (iCCA) that is deemed resectable by imaging evaluation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 45
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed recurrent or metachronous (second primary), unresectable head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, including oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, hypopharynx, cutaneous, salivary gland, paranasal sinus or cervical lymphadenopathy (head and neck cancer of unknown primary)?

DataElement.changeDescription: 2/29/16 tt, curated for 9950 and edit to long name and question text; approved and released.
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 8/4/2022: fixed the box symbol in AQT_wz
